website_summaries.verdict: With poor performance, a highly impractical design and less value than the competition, this LED isn't one we'd recommend.
pros: Feit's 40W Replacement LED sports an aesthetic-minded design that casts appealingly textured light
cons: That appeal vanishes under a lampshade, with messy, non-omnidirectional light output
The bulb also flickers badly on dimmer switches

customer_reviews.title: Avoid at (Most) Any Cost
customer_reviews.text: The only reason to buy this is price. Otherwise, these LED bulbs do not perform nearly as well as newer-generation products. As others have noted, but just to reinforce, the bulbs hum noticeably at all dimming levels, when tested in a variety of inexpensive to very expensive switches. The range of dimming is quite limited, and no where near approaches the range of incandescent bulbs or newer LEDs. Thus, these may be useful- if found at a great price - in an application that does not require dimming, in which case a CFL bulb might still be a better cost-option.
customer_reviews.author: rehoguy

customer_reviews.title: Great Replacement for Incandescents
customer_reviews.text: I bought these bulbs as replacements for my ceiling fan lights. The size and shape fits perfectly into the bell shaped glass shades. In addition, I added a Lutron Toggler dimmer switch to replace the original on/off switch. Now I can adjust the lighting in my Family Room to set or suit the mood. The bulbs only get hot at the heat sink around the neck of the bulb and you can touch the globe of the bulb, at full brightness, without burning your fingers. Since the ceiling fan hangs fairly low, It provides a bit of safety feature, should small fingers try and touch the glowing bulb.
customer_reviews.author: Geodenizen

customer_reviews.title: Check  your dimmer first.
customer_reviews.text: Make sure your dimmer is compatible before buying. There is a list on the manufacturer's website. My dimmers did not work with these bulbs. The bulbs will flicker or just completely go out immediately after turning on. Also, they make a humming sound when dimmed. I am giving them 4 stars because I am changing out my dimmers, I still want the LED bulbs. They are much brighter than regular bulbs, even the day light kind, and take much less energy to use. If you normally use a 60 watt bulb, you would only need an LED bulb that is comparable to 40 watt.
customer_reviews.author: taximom

customer_reviews.title: Won't work on all dimmers
customer_reviews.text: Bought these for the bathroom vanity, and while they aren't quite as large as the old round incandescent bulbs, they look great and produce good light. Very pleased with them. Because I was so pleased with them and they are promoted as dimmer ready, I tried them in an overhead fixture which has a remote control dimmer system. This was a fail as they would cycle on and off and on and off. They may work great in a more traditional dimmer situation but I didn't try that. Five star if you don't have to dim them but then again it might just be the type of dimmer I have.
customer_reviews.author: Jay R. Swedblom

customer_reviews.title: Revived
customer_reviews.text: Ordered a pack of three. One died after two months. I was unhappy. Took the bulb off and found no sign of damage. Put it back and it revived. It was quite tightly fixed in the socket originally so I guess the way they make the contacts may be different from the conventional bulbs. Anyway, this helps me to regain the confidence on these LED bulbs. If they stay alive for another month, I will buy more to replace the rest in my house. I would take this opportunity to remind those who had dead bulbs. They may come back to life if you put them back to the socket and tighten a bit more.
customer_reviews.author: Ten miles

customer_reviews.title: Horrible customer service
customer_reviews.text: I bought them for their dimmable properties. Unfortunately, they flick quite a bit when dimmed. Considering they are supposed to last 20+ years, that a long time to put up with flickering. One of the bulbs stopped working. I wrote the company and they essentially blamed it on me; I must have knocked it around or something. The bulb was in an overhead candelabra which never gets touched The representative suggested that I return the bulb and they would test it and consider replacing it. I'm not about to pay for shipping for one bulb. Horrible customer service. I'll never buy a product from Fiet again.
customer_reviews.author: Jokerman

customer_reviews.title: Good LED bulb for the price, with a few caveats
customer_reviews.text: It's a very good LED bulb, comparable in output to incandescents for brightness, evenness of output, and warmth; of course it uses far less energy and throws off less heat. So I'm happy with it and will probably order more of them. Warranty is only 3 years; I've seen a 10 year warranty on a competing (more expensive) brand. Downsides that aren't unique to this LED bulb, based on my test of a competing brand: The wide base means it didn't fit one of my recessed sockets High-pitched whine when used with a dimmer Dimmer at the lowest setting only takes light down 50%
customer_reviews.author: A Reader Named Matt

customer_reviews.title: Poor warranty support
customer_reviews.text: 3-year warranty? Not so bad, although the claim is that this bulb lasts 22.8 years under normal usage. Requiring me to mail the bulb for a replacement? I expected better. I suspect that the failure modes of these bulbs are fairly well understood, and fake warranty requests could be spotted easily. To me 'mail it in' is simply code for 'we don't want to stand behind our "warranty"'. Do the math, Feit. How much are you spending to process returned bulbs? How much are you saving by not sending replacement bulbs to customers who have a warranty claim when they don't mail one in? How much goodwill are you losing as a result?
customer_reviews.author: M. Rice

customer_reviews.title: These lights are awesome!
customer_reviews.text: I had some pretty bright CFL's in my bathroom and I was concerned that these LED lights would be to dim for doing things like plucking my eyebrows and such. Wholly cow was I shocked when they were actually brighter and I didn't have to wait for them to get bright anymore. I am going to start replacing all bulbs in my home with these lights. The cost is awesome....although I don't quite get why if you chose the 6 bulb option it more than triple's the price...why wouldn't you just get two packages of three
customer_reviews.author: Tami Vroma

customer_reviews.title: Upgrade and save.  No more bulb changes for a long time!
customer_reviews.text: Nice bulbs, better than the first generation LED replacement bulb by far. Remember that obnoxious blue/cold light that didn't light up the whole room? Not with these guys. I replaced my 5 vanity style bulbs in the kitchen chandelier and cut power use drastically by over 150 Watts for the same light! Those 5 will pay for themselves in just over a year and I suspect will last quite some time. Love that they are dimable. Putting these and their larger 60 Watt version everywhere.
customer_reviews.author: rustygrey

customer_reviews.title: One only lasted 2 months
customer_reviews.text: and then one burned out. Using them in identical lamps on either side of the bed. We'll see how long the other one lasts. What's funny is that nowhere on the bulb is the name FEIT stamped. I guess they don't want to advertise their brand. I was able to compare the burned out bulb to the 3rd one I haven't used yet. Seems like all these companies making LED's are constantly improving their bulbs, and changing the design, so they probably don't have enough time to test the longevity. From now on I will use a fine tip Sharpie and write the brand name and the date installed on the bulb.
customer_reviews.author: Peter

customer_reviews.title: Great for lamps and cost savings in the long term
customer_reviews.text: When I converted my apartment to all LED's, I bought a package of these because of the low energy requirement of only 7.5 watts and I just need these for the lamps. I do not use my lamps very much so I do not know if these will last the 22.8 years or how they can even make that claim. I tend to be a little skeptical that for most uses that you will see them last that long, but I still think the cost savings is definitely there. I think these are plenty bright for my use, but I would recommend getting a little more wattage and hence lumens if you are wanting to light up your entire room.
customer_reviews.author: Craetin

customer_reviews.title: Price Good, Functionality not so much
customer_reviews.text: These lights flicker and buzz a lot! Also the humming is louder at times and the flicker is more sporadic at times, I would likely pay more for a better name brand to get a little more consistency. That said, I do own another "very popular" dimmable LED brand, and those hum a lot as well. But they don't flicker. Is it worth paying roughly an extra 33% to get rid of a fairly frequent flicker? For my girlfriend and I, the answer is likely yes and I would likely not purchase this brand again; price can only help so much until the quality starts to falter.
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: An economical LED build at last!
customer_reviews.text: I have started replacing all my lights with LED and this one is the best I found. There was a review given earlier that convinced me to try this brand and I did. It is good. Eventhough it is rated at 40w, it has the brightness that come closer to 60-100w bulbs I had been using. I hope it does last for 22 years so I don't have to do this again... one 'n done. It doesn't throw out heat like the CFLs, so you are not adding a heat load to the area. This is a "warm white" which is easier on our eyes and yet bright.
customer_reviews.author: M. Kandel

customer_reviews.title: Great product but...
customer_reviews.text: I got stiffed for postage due of $3.72 which I know isn't the end of the world, but still a hassle to have to trek down to the post office to retrieve the item stand in one of those government "forever lines" and shell out extra cash for something I thought was already paid. Anyway the lights work great. I replaced 3 CFL Globe lights above the bathroom mirror with these and I love the instant on and they are very bright with a warm tone to them. The 5 stars is for the product, I only wish the seller used UPS or Fed Ex instead of USPS.
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: Cheapest price I could find, works very well!
customer_reviews.text: I got a dozen of them, 6 for my home theater celling, the rest dining room and bed rooms, Let me tell, They work well, they dim, they don't buzz, even with some old dimmer switches. I had to replace a dimmer switch of the kitchen, as it was causing them to not dim properly and flicker, the switch was kind loose, so it was with no doubt the problem Other than that all the other dimmer switches I had in the house worked very well, nice price, I will buy more, especially if price goes even lower.
customer_reviews.author: A. Khamari

customer_reviews.title: Come on when they want to
customer_reviews.text: When they come on, they are wonderful. I have used two out of the three pack and in both cases, sometimes they come on and sometimes they don't. I have one in a security light outside, half the time it does not come on all night long. Another is in a multi bulb light, again about 50% of the time it does not come on. Sometimes it will come on halfway through the day. Maybe I got a bad batch, but I would recommend finding another brand.
customer_reviews.author: D & R fm VA

customer_reviews.title: They give off a good cast for the room I am using them in ...
customer_reviews.text: They give off a good cast for the room I am using them in but the dimming part is lacking. I have them installed in high hat lights and I have an Led dimmer switch on them but they do not dim down as I expected. They seem to only dim about 50%. They work for me in the room I purchased them for but if I needed them really dim, they would not suitable. It is a trade off for the heat and energy use of a regular bulb so I am totally sold on LED bulbs as a whole, but these are not the best.
customer_reviews.author: chip's mom

customer_reviews.title: Color Temperature is a bit off
customer_reviews.text: I bought a pack of these for our Kitchen ceiling fan. The three 40w bulbs produce a nice amount of light, BUT the color temperature is a bit off. The package says 3000K, which typically is a nice warm white but these bulbs, in my opinion, are a bit north of 4000k, yielding a bit of a greenish/bluish cast. A bit disappointing on the color. On the plus side, there is no flicker, they do have the instant on and they are dimmable. I probably would not buy this brand again if their color rendering is that far off.
customer_reviews.author: S. Hill

customer_reviews.title: Really love the light
customer_reviews.text: Great lights, I am using them over the vanities and they give amazing light. They package says they are good for 22 years, I know LED lights are good. This number of years sounds exceptional (they are a bit pricey, but if they last even close to the 22 years, the price is wonderful).
customer_reviews.author: Roxalot

customer_reviews.title: Nice bulbs if they all work bought two packs got one dud.
customer_reviews.text: Bought a package of these bulbs, I liked them so much ordered another set and one bulb was bad, It would only work if you touched it, once you shut it off it would not come on till you touched it. I did not send them all back not worth the hassle, all the others are working fine, much whiter light, than a CFL the same wattage, which takes a little getting used to, overall good bulbs time will tell if they last as long as they claim.
customer_reviews.author: K. Keller

customer_reviews.title: Have had no issues with these and they do produce some great light for a eight foot ceiling
customer_reviews.text: These baby's are bright on my three light fan devise. Maybe a little too bright for night time viewing of computer work. The fan light is located just to the rear and above my desk. The room is small so this is something to think about. Have had no issues with these and they do produce some great light for a eight foot ceiling. During the day however these give the right amount of light for viewing photography images on a thirty in monitor. Nice even light, no shadows that I can see of.
customer_reviews.author: Allan

customer_reviews.title: 2 of the 3 Did Not Last...
customer_reviews.text: 2 of the 3 bulbs went out. The first one went out within 2 weeks. The second one lasted about 10 months before going out. They are side by side Energetic Lighting LED bulbs which are all still going strong. I have Energetic Lighting bulbs in all my ceiling fans and single fixture lights throughout the house and they are far superior to these Feit bulbs. You are wasting your money if you buy these.
customer_reviews.author: David A

customer_reviews.title: Good quality bulbs
customer_reviews.text: I've been using these bulbs for about 6 months now and I'm very pleased with them. The dimming works well although they do flicker a little when I first turn the dimmer up to the max. It only flickers for a few seconds and I'm not sure if it's the bulbs or my wiring. I would like to use led bulbs throughout my entire house but they are still a little too expensive. If you want led bulbs then these are a good choice.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas Ryans

customer_reviews.title: Perfect replacement
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these bulbs to replace incandescent bulbs in three glass pendents over our kitchen island. The reason I bought them was that the heat from the incandescent bulbs would cause the ceramic nut holding the globe on to slowly unscrew from the alternating heat and cooling of turning them on and off. The LED bulbs not only solved that problem but they put out more light and the color temperature is a perfect match for the incandescents.
customer_reviews.author: M. Barber

customer_reviews.title: So far, so good.
customer_reviews.text: So far, so good. I haven't had them for long so I can't speak for how long they last or anything. I can say that I took them out of the package, screwed then into my fixtures and they worked. The light was fine. They start instantaneously. I am completely happy with them so far. My only question is will this continue. Personally, I expect it will. I see no reason to question it. My review is based on my experience and that has been quite short.
customer_reviews.author: Jerry Wilson

customer_reviews.title: Works as expected, seems equal to or brighter than regular 40W bulb
customer_reviews.text: This was a good deal for LED bulbs. They're nothing special, but the color and brightness of light were spot on. I have two wall sconces, each with two bulbs, on a single switch. They have tinted glass shades, so the bulbs are not exposed but the tops are open. I now have these three bulbs plus one soft white incandescent, and unless you look closely you would not notice the slight difference in color.
customer_reviews.author: TiffMomNYC

customer_reviews.title: compact, bright, versatile and efficient
customer_reviews.text: I don't know if these bulbs will last the advertised 23 years, but they're affordable and will replace a standard incandescent bulb while using very little electricity. These are bright and actually seem comparable to a 60 watt incandescent bulb! The light is less warm, but this can be corrected by using a warm colored lampshade. They are rated as suitable for damp locations, and will operate at temps above -4F.
customer_reviews.author: T. Fiero

customer_reviews.title: Best LED Bulb I have bought!!!!
customer_reviews.text: This is one great LED bulb. I ordered these and 12 CREE 60 watt bulbs. I wish I had ordered all Feit bulbs. There is nothing to complain about they are just super. They look good, dim nicely and seem to proportionally brighter than the CREE bulbs. I will buy them again and would recommend them to anyone that wants a great 40 Watt LED bulb!!!! I bought 6 of them and then ordered more.
customer_reviews.author: ROM

customer_reviews.title: Lasted 4+ years
customer_reviews.text: I bought 2 packages of these in June, 2014. I am just now having to replace them. We used these in our kitchen, so they were on a lot of the time, day & night.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Amazon 3 pack pricing fantastic, highly recommend, save on electric bill being seen already!
customer_reviews.text: Relamped whole house and installed 40W LED type in places 60W incandescents were months ago and already noticing the electric bill savings! Tried cheaper type at a big brand store (lots of them) and after less than 2 days I returned every one of them because they flickered on single pole switches! These have been installed with not a one issue and the Amazon pricing was fantastic for 3 bulbs in a package.
customer_reviews.author: KL

customer_reviews.title: Not what I wanted
customer_reviews.text: I returned these bulbs after trying them in a ceiling fan. Bulbs were not as bright (I know now that I prefer daylight bulbs) as I wanted. Had no problem returning them, ordered other led candelabra bulbs that were just what I wanted, If you like the color softer white color don't hesitate to order, you will probably be happy
customer_reviews.author: mets fan

customer_reviews.title: Bulbs appear to be well made. They are listed ...
customer_reviews.text: Bulbs appear to be well made. They are listed as 3K in color which is more white then the 2700K. I read that they do hum a little when dimmed and YES they do hum. I have they in my bedroom fan and you can hear the hum. I however won't be dimming them that much, but be aware the hum is noticeable at least with 3 bulbs being dimmed in the same fixture. The price can't be beat though!
customer_reviews.author: D. Germann

customer_reviews.title: The box says may not work with all dimmers but I don't know how anyone can figure out if they'll work without buying them and tr
customer_reviews.text: Lights are bright and price was right but they don't work with my dimmers. Once put into sockets, they won't turn off even with switch turned off. They do seem to work ok if there is at least one incandescent bulb on the same switch. The box says may not work with all dimmers but I don't know how anyone can figure out if they'll work without buying them and trying There has to be a better way.
customer_reviews.author: Rick at Skiboater

customer_reviews.title: Save your money and invest in better quality ones like the Cree 9
customer_reviews.text: 6 months ago, I updated my full house with LED light bulbs. I tried a few different ones and will NOT be buying these again. After 6 months, 1 of the 3 bulbs stopped working completely and one is flickering. Those are cheaper and there's a reason. Save your money and invest in better quality ones like the Cree 9.5 watt. They feel better and I have not had a single one of them failing yet (despite having installed more than 10 and using them daily.)
customer_reviews.author: JC

customer_reviews.title: Love These and Saving Money
customer_reviews.text: The light these provide is perfect for indoors. I have a dimmer switch on my ceiling fans and they are dimmable without buzzing. I am gradually changing over every bulb in my house as well as my outdoor porch light. Don't worry about wattage. Just make sure the lumens rating is bright enough for your needs. These are 500 lumens which is perfectly fine for ceiling fans, lamps, reading etc.
customer_reviews.author: Timothy Greene

customer_reviews.title: Perfect color and compact size
customer_reviews.text: These Feit LED bulbs are better than most replacement LED lights. The color temperature of these bulbs is in the perfect spot between yellow of "soft" lights and the blue feel of "daylight" bulbs. They give off even light 360 degrees around the axis of the bulb and don't have any obvious shadows above or below as some LED bulbs do. They fit well in fixtures that were designed for the shape of traditional incandescent bulbs.
customer_reviews.author: CJB

customer_reviews.title: AMAZINGLY FLICKER FREE!
customer_reviews.text: I have been on the hunt for LED bulbs that are flicker-free / strobe-free when dimmed. These bulbs are the SOLUTION! These bulbs exhibit NONE of the flickering/strobing effects that can lead to headaches and eyestrain. If you want LED bulbs that look as good as incandescent ones in a canopy or open-bottomed fixture and hold their color rendition through a variety of brightness levels, these are the bulbs for you!
customer_reviews.author: Davis P

customer_reviews.title: A little unreliable, but good nevertheless
customer_reviews.text: I like these, but the one in the kitchen flicks on and off, and the one above the sink sometimes refuses to turn on at all. Since regular light bulbs never did that, I don't think it is the wiring in the house. So I sort of wonder what is up with these bulbs that are supposed to last for 23 years. The two in the bedroom lamps--no problem at all.
customer_reviews.author: Aristocats

customer_reviews.title: NOT WHITE! Caveat emptor!
customer_reviews.text: So these are great little LED household lights at a decent price and I'm sure they will hold up fine. They are NOT WHITE however which for me is half the fun of LED lighting. They went all retro yellow light with them to appease lame ppl like my wife who prefer old school yellow incandescent/halogens. Jump in to the 21st century I say!!
customer_reviews.author: rayman 850

customer_reviews.title: Good price, good light, but they strobe when dimmed low even on LED-compatible dimmer.
customer_reviews.text: I installed a LED/CFL compatible dimmer (Lutron Ariadni C-L model AYCL-153P) before switching to LED bulbs. The FEIT BR30 flood lights dim just fine, but these A19 40 Watt replacement LED bulbs strobe at medium and low dimming. The package clearly says "dimmable", but they aren't, at least with the dimmer I have. Otherwise they are great bulbs which I highly recommend if you aren't installing them on a circuit that has a dimmer switch.
customer_reviews.author: Robert J. Pierce

customer_reviews.title: Not good with dimmers
customer_reviews.text: These bulbs were bought for a 4-wY light attached to a GE dimmer. As soon as they were turned to 100%, they all flicked off. These bulbs flickered badly at most light levels. They work great in on/off lamps, but seem to have major problems with dimmers. Tried in 2 separate fixtures, same problem. Osram seem to work fine.
customer_reviews.author: Kemyst

customer_reviews.title: Dont turn all way off on a multilevel dinner
customer_reviews.text: My husband purchased these to be more energy efficient. Light level is nice, however they will only dim and do not turn all the way off, even when you turn off the switch. I don't know if it is only made to handle a certain number of dimming levels, but for our Lutron kitchen switches that have 7 levels, they do not work properly. Light level is nice however.
customer_reviews.author: Brendlin

customer_reviews.title: which is a good thing when it comes to LED bulbs
customer_reviews.text: Really Bright, which is a good thing when it comes to LED bulbs. They also seem to be well built, and look like they will indeed last for a very long time. The dimming feature, however, could use some work; while it smoothly dims into a lower brightness, it will sometimes hang up when trying to brighten them with the dimmer and won't brighten until the highest setting is reached.
customer_reviews.author: Peter Aguilar

customer_reviews.title: Humming
customer_reviews.text: These bulbs arrived on time and in good shape but every single one of them hums as much as (possibly more than) the dimmable cfl bulbs they were purchased to replace. They are bright enough certainly but in a quiet room if you have reasonable hearing these will drive you crazy.
customer_reviews.author: Xgate

customer_reviews.title: I have been very happy with these
customer_reviews.text: I've been using these 40w replacement bulbs to replace standard 60w bulbs, and the rooms are much brighter with these bulbs. I have been very happy with these, and I continue to order these as I need new bulbs. I've only had one bulb with an issue, and I keep getting hung up on when I call to try and get it replaced. Their customer service could use a little work.
customer_reviews.author: JasonV

customer_reviews.title: Not what they used to be
customer_reviews.text: I've been buying these through Amazon for years now, but it would appear that they're not what they used to be. My most recent ones are blinking every few minutes when they are dimmed. So a living room, den, or bedroom is no longer a great place to use them. Anywhere you don't use the dimmer - they're fine.
customer_reviews.author: Mosheen

customer_reviews.title: These seem ideal.
customer_reviews.text: They're offbrand so they're cheap, but they give off a very nice light that replaces three "curly fry" lights in my kitchen. The dimming works with the old style dimmer in my living room, so I don't "need" to buy a new 25 dollar LED dimmer. But maybe I should. I think I'll buy more of these bulbs, eventually. They should pay for themselves.
customer_reviews.author: Steven

customer_reviews.title: LED light bulbs with full range
customer_reviews.text: I love LED bulbs because of the energy savings and because they are so much better looking that goofy CFL bulbs. I was a little disappointed with my first LED bulbs because they didn't have a very good range of light so I was pleased when I found these bulbs that work much more like a traditional light bulb.
customer_reviews.author: MNSuzy

customer_reviews.title: Well made LED product!
customer_reviews.text: Perfect even in a totally airtight spaces. These bulbs are indeed true just like it says dimmable from zero to 40. Nicely emits pleasant natural color and they refused to get hot. For how long? So far so good. Usually I will get the usual "I just got ripped off" feeling within weeks after buying LED bulbs. But not these. de
customer_reviews.author: J Valenzuela

customer_reviews.title: Bathroom lights
customer_reviews.text: I have replaced the lights in all of my bathrooms with these. Each bathroom fixture has four bulbs so these 40 W replacements are just what I was looking for. I like the color, the fact that they come on right away and they save power (30 W vs. 160 W per bathroom). I've been using them since last summer.
customer_reviews.author: T. E.

customer_reviews.title: Very Bright
customer_reviews.text: These LED bulbs are excellent! They are very bright for a 40 watt bulb. Just keep in mind they aren't the fancy light blue LED bulbs they are standard yellow but thats ok. These bulbs don't just save you some money on your electric bill, but using these bulbs also does a good deed for the environment.
customer_reviews.author: Monster Matt

customer_reviews.title: 1 bad egg in the bunch--so far
customer_reviews.text: got 1 bulb already burned out,november2014 to feburary 2015 is an awfully SHORT 22.8 years--as they say in the add,3 hrs. a day--this one has only been turned on maby 15 times & at the most1.5 hrs on time each time.not looking to good.
customer_reviews.author: the old man

customer_reviews.title: Very nice replacement for incandescent
customer_reviews.text: Light is pretty close to incandescent bulb, a bit whiter but good. Actually it's brighter than a regular 40W, I replace 3 60W bulbs in our bathroom with these and it's bright enough. Although it does not give you 360 degree light spread, it's pretty close. I wouldn't use it for a reading light, for that go for 60W equivalent.
customer_reviews.author: Peter Kubiaczyk

customer_reviews.title: 7.5 W LED dimmable
customer_reviews.text: Great value. The saving is not just from the efficiency of the bulb but it does not give out as much heat so it relieves the AC usage. The 40W bulb seems to be brighter than a regular incand lamp but I don't have any scientific evidence to substantiate that. I have not used the dimmable function of the bulb yet.
customer_reviews.author: TheChanMan

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful light
customer_reviews.text: Very pleasant light - looks full spectrum, not too blue, not too yellow. They do hum a bit when dimmed and can flicker when dimmed very far, but I'm pleased with them. Replaced six 40W Reveal incandescent bulbs that were constantly burning out in a chandelier, and the light from the Feits is superior.
customer_reviews.author: Benjamin Liberman

customer_reviews.title: Bulb burnt out
customer_reviews.text: The product description tells how these bulbs will last over 20 years. I've bought 6 of these bulbs so far and after less than 3 months one of the LED bulbs I put in my ceiling fixture is already burnt out. I couldn't find a way to contact seller before leaving feedback. I will update after more time goes by on the other bulbs.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin

customer_reviews.title: Dimmable, yes but only to a point. You ...
customer_reviews.text: Dimmable, yes but only to a point. You have to turn the light on full then dim it back. Very difficult to know the lowest dim setting. When dimming you have to 'remember' how far you have turned the dimmer switch or the light just goes out then you have to start all over...full brightness then gradually dime.
customer_reviews.author: Dan Gardner

customer_reviews.title: Make sure you use a newer dimmer switch!
customer_reviews.text: These really do work well, and are shaped like older tungsten bulbs, which is handy for older fixtures. A word of warning: don't try to use an older dimmer with LED or CFL bulbs. The reason is complicated, but if you don't use a newer dimmer made for LEDs or CFLs, you are going to get flicker. That's not unique to these bulbs: this is true for all LED and CFL bulbs. Guess how much money I spent on lighting equipment before I found this out.
customer_reviews.author: A. P.

customer_reviews.title: Led light bulbs
customer_reviews.text: I saw this set of led bulbs in Costco which is low price already. But when I search on amazon, this same package appear to be lot less expensive. So I ordered it and save myself money. Great buy. Bulbs work great. Save energy with only 7 w versus my previous 40w. I will recommend this buying to my family and friends.
customer_reviews.author: stanley

customer_reviews.title: Great Product
customer_reviews.text: Excellent product. Nice white bright light. Have one in bathroom and hallway where they are on for many hours. Well packaged and quickly delivered. Can't comment on life guarantee as I am 82 and if correct they will outlive me. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Philip A. Wilcox

customer_reviews.title: Great dimmable light.
customer_reviews.text: Love the dimmable light. Using it in my living room where I have a dimmer switch . Good light power. Makes the room whatever brightness I want. Just what I wanted and needed. Been wanting one of these for quuite awhile.
customer_reviews.author: John A Mountford Jr

customer_reviews.title: great deal
customer_reviews.text: we bought the same bulbs in the store but these were a slightly better deal than a sale at walmart when we needed a few more. we used them in garage opener, front porch, patio, hallway, closet, over bathtub, shower & a toilet room~ all provide ample warm color light that does seem 40w equivalent. we have not used the dimmable feature.
customer_reviews.author: peaceskr

customer_reviews.title: Cost effective solution
customer_reviews.text: Reversed a three lamp fixture in the bathroom and saved the expense of replacing the fixture with a more expensive one. Prefer light that bounces off ceiling and brightens entire room. Is also cooler temperature wise.
customer_reviews.author: Chuckles

customer_reviews.title: Little more light for less!
customer_reviews.text: These lights work great. They give a large amount of light using 4 bulbs on a dimmer switch. They replaced 4-40 watt bulbs with 4-7.5 watt blubs. I bought 3 packs for two fan light fixtures using four bulbs. I hope the investment will pay off.
customer_reviews.author: E. J. Squeeze

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Replacement for Incandescents
customer_reviews.text: These are perfect replacements for our regular 40 watt bulbs but use less than 20% of the electricity. They're closer in color to fluorescent bulbs but not as harsh and these LED bulbs tend to flicker a bit when on dimmers. You don't notice that effect when on a regular switch.
customer_reviews.author: The Radio Daddio

customer_reviews.title: Hey, they work.
customer_reviews.text: I have a couple small lamps I leave on 24/7 as night lights or to make it look like someone lives at my house while I'm away. I don't feel as bad about wasting electricity with these LED bulbs now. I tried one on a Westeck touch dimmer and it didn't like that though, so not sure about the dimmable claim.
customer_reviews.author: Brett M.

customer_reviews.title: LED Does it Again
customer_reviews.text: Everything is moving to LED. They use only 20% of the energy which saves 80%. Wow, what a bargain. These lights perform perfectly and at a very good price point. I use both the 60's and 40's throughout the house.
customer_reviews.author: Doug Felsenthal

customer_reviews.title: Cool bulbs.
customer_reviews.text: These are very good bulbs. The plastic case dissipates all of the heat, which is very little compared to an incandescent or even a CFL bulb. The glass bulb part stays cool. I can't verify them lasting 20 years yet. Six out of six are still working fine after 3 months. I will buy more.
customer_reviews.author: James L Smith

customer_reviews.title: Crap lights
customer_reviews.text: I bought 12 bulbs, and 3 of them are crap. They don't turn on right away, they dim, they go crazy up there, turn on whenever they want... Tried to return but how convenient... they started acting up 1 day after the 30 day return policy,..
customer_reviews.author: Jey

customer_reviews.title: Very Good!
customer_reviews.text: I got these today. I switched them out with some of the CFL's that I had from FEIT. These were definitely brighter than the CFL's. The CFL's that I had were 13 watts and these are 7.5 watts. I will order some more in the following weeks. I will keep this review updated in case anything happens with these LEDs. From El Paso, TX
customer_reviews.author: Storm

customer_reviews.title: So far after a month only one failed
customer_reviews.text: Bought a bunch trying to switch over to LED. Out of all purchased only one has failed so far after a months use. Light is nice and even, no dead spots.
customer_reviews.author: J. Hooverman

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Perfect bulbs, exactly what I was wanting. Dimmable, no humming, great light. Packaged well, all bulbs worked.
customer_reviews.author: Kimberly

customer_reviews.title: Better wattage and led produce led rating exists
customer_reviews.text: Modern technology has made this an item of the past. Better wattage and led produce led rating exists.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan

customer_reviews.title: I wish these would dim a little lower. The ...
customer_reviews.text: I wish these would dim a little lower. The lowest dimness is still much brighter than a comparable dimmed incandescent. I get some noise at lower levels as well. I am using a Lutron Maestro dimmer (LED dimmer). I will try something else in the future.
customer_reviews.author: William

customer_reviews.title: LED performance at a reasonable price
customer_reviews.text: Have had good success with Feit products. Wanted these for several lower wattage equivalent applications. Run cool to touch, good light output (color and lumen intensity), no buzzing or noise, illuminate quickly, no problem in fit, appear to be of good quality.
customer_reviews.author: Richard J

customer_reviews.title: Bright enough
customer_reviews.text: These seem like regular light bulbs. I have only been using them for a week do I don't know about durability. I like what I see so far. They have the same level of brightness as the 40w I replaced.
customer_reviews.author: Tommy

customer_reviews.title: Waste
customer_reviews.text: Bought one year ago of the original purchase of 9 bulbs 3 lasted less than 1 year. I have installed the remainder. The ads indicate years of use The fact is for the price they are more expensive but do not last any longer than incondesant in same application
customer_reviews.author: jwh

customer_reviews.title: so far so good
customer_reviews.text: Its hard to judge a light bulb.. it either works or it doesn't... they have a nice softy light.. i will have to get back to you WAY in the future to see if they last the 23 years they say they do..sounds like a recipe for disaster for the company if they do : )
customer_reviews.author: Deckieg

customer_reviews.title: The Dimmable LED light bulbs out performed my expectations. ...
customer_reviews.text: The Dimmable LED light bulbs out performed my expectations. Have replaced almost all the standart light bulbs in my home to LED. The Feit 7.5 Watt A19 bulbs were a pleasant surprise and I will be recommending this product to my family and friends.
customer_reviews.author: W1ndjamm3r

customer_reviews.title: Great Lights
customer_reviews.text: I bought these to replace the incandescent bulbs in the lamp stand with dimming. They work well! Good light, NO heat! I have not shopped for price, just utility.
customer_reviews.author: Tom

customer_reviews.title: one has burnt out in short time-now two burnt out
customer_reviews.text: I have bought 3 packs (9 bulbs). One bulb burned out 7/27/14- it was in place less than 2 months. Hope it's just an anomaly, will edit an update if more last a short period. The light is fine and no noise from them. Second bulb burnt out 8/7/2014.
customer_reviews.author: typeA_feedingOs

customer_reviews.title: works but hums
customer_reviews.text: got because they labeled them as dimmable and they are going in a location that the lights are on most of every evening. they do light as well as you would expect a light bulb to light, but anything below full intensity creates a subtle buzzing/humming noise. Quickest fix seems to be just having a conversation or turning on the tube.
customer_reviews.author: Adam M.

customer_reviews.title: just as bright
customer_reviews.text: ive had these for a year and so far so good. the quality is there. im slowly buying these to replace my CFLs.
customer_reviews.author: great8

customer_reviews.title: Bright, good quality, great deal!
customer_reviews.text: These were brighter than I expected, good quality and work well. They have a brief fade out effect when you flip the light switch off, which isn't a problem, just an interesting note about them. This is a good deal for a good, bright, LED bulb.
customer_reviews.author: Joe

customer_reviews.title: Been using these for some time now in the lights ...
customer_reviews.text: Been using these for some time now in the lights over my kitchen island an they work very well in lighting the area.
customer_reviews.author: tony

customer_reviews.title: It's great for lights outside or other lights that you need ...
customer_reviews.text: LED lights are where it's at. They are instantly bright when turned on and don't get very hot. It's great for lights outside or other lights that you need to leave on for long periods of time, like at night.
customer_reviews.author: Jared Hay

customer_reviews.title: Great bulbd at a great price
customer_reviews.text: I installed these LED bulbs above my bathroom vanity. The color is natural and warm. The brightness is what I would expect with a 40 watt incandescent bulb. They come on instantly with no buzzing. I've been using them for thirty days now with no problems. The price was the best I've found even beating out some single packs of the same brand / model bulb at Big Lots.
customer_reviews.author: R. Cannon

customer_reviews.title: Wrong Bulbs Arrived
customer_reviews.text: I ordered A19 bulbs, but received G25 bulbs (large globes). I tried only one. I like the color, but the G25s don't look right in my ceiling fixture. I returned them. I may try to re-order, but I'm afraid I'll receive more of the same.
customer_reviews.author: Alabuc

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed: I bought several of these based on the ...
customer_reviews.text: Disappointed: I bought several of these based on the apparent value, and name brand. I have other types of bulbs by Feit that have performed pretty well. 9 months later I have replaced them with other various bulbs including the incandescent bulbs that were originally in the fixture. They don't last anywhere near what the claim and I am still in the search for a good value LED bulb I can count on to last.
customer_reviews.author: david Hale

customer_reviews.title: Great dimming range.
customer_reviews.text: By far the best bulbs I have purchased on Amazon. Other dimmable LED bulbs I purchased didn't dim low enough at their lowest setting, these do very well.
customer_reviews.author: Brian W

customer_reviews.title: Theses bulbs are great over a year old and no problem with them ...
customer_reviews.text: Theses bulbs are great over a year old and no problem with them I placed them in bathroom fixture over the mirror. and yes I did buy them again at Lowes they also had a sale there on these bulbs.
customer_reviews.author: Jeanette

customer_reviews.title: Great Bulbs.
customer_reviews.text: A bit pricey, but if they work for as long as they say they will be well worth it. The light from theses are not too bright- unlike others I have bought on here. They stay cool to the touch and seem to do just fine in the elements outside.
customer_reviews.author: Loosearrow

customer_reviews.title: Decent price, does buzz a little when not at maximum with regular dimmer
customer_reviews.text: Maybe I need to use a special dimmer? I installed 6 of these in a dining room fixture to save on power costs. 6 regular incandescent bulbs use a lot of juice so this was a good choice at a good price and they fit fine. Buzzing is really not annoying or noticeable unless very quiet in the room.
customer_reviews.author: Chris L

customer_reviews.title: works well
customer_reviews.text: I had one bulb out of three went bad after 1-2 weeks, but the replacement package has been working fine. Amazon said I could return the one bulb, but I would only get 20% of the price for the 3.
customer_reviews.author: Kax

customer_reviews.title: ive had them for over a year still going and ...
customer_reviews.text: ive had them for over a year still going and they get used a lot i put them in the bathroom light fixture
customer_reviews.author: Michael Steensma

customer_reviews.title: Great deal on dimmable LEDs.
customer_reviews.text: These are dimmable but not as linear as an incandescent bulb. Replacing 6 incandescent bulbs at 60 watts each will save a ton over the years.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen

customer_reviews.title: Very satisfied. My 4th set.
customer_reviews.text: My 4th set over 6 months. Not 1 failure yet. Very satisfied, going to order more.
customer_reviews.author: Bill E.

customer_reviews.title: good light bulbs
customer_reviews.text: Good light bulbs, but they are not really dimable. They flicker constantly when dimmed, and they won't even turn on if the dimmer is below a certain point. Good bulbs, great price, minus a start for the flickering when dimmed.
customer_reviews.author: RedSocks157

customer_reviews.title: Shorter life span than advertised
customer_reviews.text: Bought a three pack, only decided to write a review when the first one failed at 15 months, well short of the 22 years stated by the manufacturer. We only use these for minutes per day, I'll update when the others fail...
customer_reviews.author: Dana Sherman

product_meta.title: Feit 7.5 Watt A19 Dimmable LED Light Bulbs 3-Pack (equiv to 40 watts)
